We call on McDonalds to use this opportunity to do more than remain neutral by using its vast influence to advocate for an end to the Israeli Occupation.

items.description: Roark Capital is a $37 billion investment fund run by Neal Aronson that has bought out many restaurant and other franchise concepts. items.name: Netflix
items.description: Netflix introduced a collection titled Palestinian Stories showcasing films by acclaimed Arab filmmakers like Born in Gaza, while also carrying Israeli content like Fauda, which glorifies Israeli security forces and perpetuates a biased narrative.  The platform’s release of Palestinian or Israeli films doesn’t necessarily reflect support for a political cause. Instead, it aligns with Netflix mission to showcase diverse global narratives. We advise you to avoid any choices associated with artists who have publicly supported Israel.

items.name: Burger King

Another 18.1% of Ackman's portfolio consists of Chipotle stock. Over 30% of his assets are in these four brands. We cannot contribute to increasing Bill Ackman's wealth and will continue to follow and expose his investments.

He seems to be ignoring one of the most significant refugee crisis of our time, created as a result of the Occupation of Palestine. Although we hope he is working behind the scenes to help, now is not a time to remain silent. He has not responded to our email asking for an explanation. We urge you all to join our effort to ask him to speak in support of Palestine by contacting the company by phone, email, and social media.

items.name: Dr Bronners
items.description: Dr. Bronner’s is a proud Jewish American family owned company that has shown they put justice over profits by taking a strong stand against the Occupation in a way we would like to see other companies do. Although their products are sold in Israel, the company put out a statement on Jan 8/2024 calling for Ceasefire, ending US aid for the war, and acknowledging the historical context of Occupation that led to Oct 7. While the company was founded in 1948 by self-proclaimed Zionist Emmanuel Bronner, it has evolved through two generations to become a champion of social justice everywhere, including Palestine. It sources 90% of the olive oil used in its products from Canaan, a Palestinian owned company near Jenin that works closely with the Palestine Fair Trade Association and its 1700 small farmers. The other 10% of its olive oil is sourced from Sindyanna, a fair trade business run by Arab and Jewish women in Israel.
